intro: Kakosmanthus argenteus, commonly known as the silver-leafed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that are often covered in a silvery or grayish bloom, giving it its common name. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Kakosmanthus argenteus is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
